page.title: 05LIFE AT TATTON HALL
page.content: A SENSE OF A TATTON'S PAST WAY OF LIFE CAN BE GLIMPSED BY A VISIT TO THE KITCHENS WITH THE ENORMOUS COAL BURNING KITCHEN RANGE AND OPEN FIRE WITH SPIT TURNING; THE BUTLER'S PANTRY AND CELLAR BOOKS WITH WINE LISTS; SCULLERY, STILL ROOM AND HOUSEKEEPER'S SITTING ROOM AND THE ROW OF BELLS TO SUMMON SERVANTS. THE HOUSE IS STILL LIVED IN FOR THE TOP FLOOR HAS BEEN CONVERTED TO FLATS FOR THE ADMINISTRATOR AND SOME OF HIS STAFF. A LARGE WORK FORCE IS EMPLOYED, NUMBERS FLUCTUATING WITH THE SEASONS, IN THE OFFICES, AS GUIDES AND ATTENDANTS,GARDENERS, PARK RANGERS, FORESTERS AND CATERING, MAINTENANCE AND CLEANING STAFF.
